intro: Chamaemelum segetum, commonly known as field chamomile, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like yellow flowers with white ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has finely divided, grass-like leaves. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is used in aromatherapy and traditional medicine for its calming and anti-inflammatory properties.
